result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Todd Clauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate. 
Defendant shall not possess any firearms.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael Todd Clauer in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Michael Todd Clauer. Defendant will be pleading to charge. State will recommend 3 years probation with the following conditions: counseling deemed appropriate by DOC, not to possess any firearms, and court costs. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. State heard. Attorney Mickelson heard. Court heard and orders 2 years probation with the following conditions: to pay court costs, provide a DNA sample, to have such assessment, counseling, programming, and treatment that DOC deems appropriate, and not to posses any firearms. If revoked, 16 days credit.

Defendant Michael Todd Clauer appeared by video from GCJ.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Michael Todd Clauer. Atty Michelson submitted waiver of PH for all cases. Court reviewed the waiver of rights with defendant and counsel. Court finds the Defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives his rights and binds the matter over. State will be filing Information with same charges. Defendant enters a plea of NG to all cases.  Status: 7/20/22 at 10:00 am. JT Weeks: 8/2/22 & 8/9/22
Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Preliminary hearing on June 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Michael Todd Clauer appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Michael Todd Clauer. Attorney Mickelson has been appointed. Requests preliminary hearing and to be heard on bond reduction. Court finds good cause to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Attorney Michelson heard on bond and requests a lower cash bond or a signature bond. Attorney Riniker heard on bond. Court heard and reduces bond to $200 cash. Preliminary hearing set.

Defendant Michael Todd Clauer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anthony Pozorski in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Defendant referred to SPD. Keep trying to make contact. State requests $500 cash bond, each file, totaling $2500. Defendant heard. Court sets bond at $500, each case, totaling $2500. Status as to counsel set.
